method.name: POST
method.doc: To configure a resource for policy attachment, issue an HTTP POST command on the policy attachments resource URI.

Resources must be configured in order to have policies attached to them. This process is dependent on prior installation and configuration of an IBM Verify Identity Access for Web runtime component and reverse proxy server. Through this configuration, protected objects are defined and therefore can be identified and configured for policy attachment.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service.

param.name: server
param.doc: The web container that contains the protected object space for a server instance.

param.name: resourceUri
param.doc: The resource URI of the resource in the protected object space.

param.name: policies
param.doc: Array of attachments (policy, policy sets, and API protection definitions) that define the access protection for this resource. In order to define the policy attachments for this resource at a later time, an empty array ([]) can be specified.

param.name: policyCombiningAlgorithm
param.doc: "permitOverrides" to allow access to the rescource if any of the attachments return permit; "denyOverrides" to deny access to the resource if any of the attachments return deny. Default is "denyOverrides".

param.name: cache
param.doc: 0 to disable the cache for this resource, -1 to cache the decision for the lifetime of the session or any number greater than 1 to set a specific timeout (in seconds) for the cached decision. If not specified a default of 0 will be used.

param.name: id
param.doc: Internally assigned ID value of the policy, policy set, or API protection definition to be attached to the resource.

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of attachment. Values include 'policy', 'policyset', or 'definition'.

response.doc: Created. A new resource was created. The request was successful.
Bad Request. There is a problem with the request. The JSON result describes the problem.
Not Found. The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
Conflict. The JSON result indicates the problem.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
